content: in a civil case heard by the tartu county court a final resolution was issued on 15112021 the case involved a lawsuit filed by tk against mr regarding the division of joint assets the judge partially settled the claim by dividing the common property and ordering mr to compensate tk with a certain amount of money both parties will share the procedural costs the judgment will be delivered to the parties involved who have the option to appeal the decision within 30 days tk claims that they were married to mr acquired land during the marriage and repeatedly proposed dividing the property but mr disagreed tk also included joint assets in the claim mr admits to part of the claim but disagrees with the division of the property and raises objections regarding payments made during the privatization of the land the claimant alleges that the defendant removed farm equipment from the property the defendant purchased various spare parts and equipment during the marriage and proposes a compromise to divide the property and compensate the claimant alternatively the parties could gift the property to their children the claimant also seeks compensation for mortgage payments made by the defendant during the marriage the defendant agrees to the compromise proposal and is willing to pay a certain amount of money the claimant is also willing to give up any claims for the defendants behavior the court must determine the value of the assets and divide them between the parties taking into account the fact that the defendant received a larger share of the joint assets through inheritance ultimately the court decides on a certain amount of compensation for the claimant and orders each party to bear their own procedural costs
